title: Switch Python BDD to Behave
description: Replace pytest-bdd with Behave for Python Gherkin execution, keep shared specs in specs/features, update tooling and parity checks.
creator: Ryan Alyn Porter

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Goal: migrate Python BDD from pytest-bdd to Behave while keeping specs in specs/features and parity with Rust. Acceptance: behave runs shared Gherkin, pytest only for unit tests, parity tool updated, remove pytest-bdd usage.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Continuing work on aligning Python specs with Gherkin/Behave. Next: locate current pytest-bdd usage, identify failing scenarios, and update Python step definitions/runner accordingly.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Aligned spec parity tooling to read Behave steps under python/features/steps and added Python close/delete step definitions. Added python/features/specs symlink to shared specs and ensured Behave environment adds python/src to sys.path. Updated check_spec_parity to decode escaped quotes correctly. Still need to validate behave run setup and any doc updates.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Continuing with plan: run Behave against shared specs, capture failures, and implement missing Python steps or harness fixes. Will update docs if any references to pytest-bdd remain.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Ran Behave; resolved ambiguous step definitions by moving common Given into python/features/steps/common_steps.py. Added python/behave.ini to target features/specs and skip @wip scenarios. Updated issue creation/update specs and step definitions to quote multi-word --title/--description values so CLI parsing matches behavior. Behave now passes for non-wip scenarios; parity check still clean.

comments.author: Ryan Alyn Porter
comments.text: Updated implementation plan references from pytest-bdd to Behave, including layout and configuration notes. Added Behave config in python/behave.ini to target features/specs and skip @wip. Re-ran check_spec_parity and behave; non-wip scenarios pass.
